name: hexamethylene diisocyanate
Reason: 1,6-Diisocyanatohexane has a melting point of -100.0°C. The basic unit for this compound can be considered hexamethylene (with a melting point of -169.2°C) because the isocyanate group introduces a rigid structure and a high melting point. The isocyanate group itself can contribute around +20°C due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and increase molecular rigidity. The hexamethylene chain adds approximately +10°C due to its increased molecular weight and rigidity.
